People who study astronomy, called astronomers, try to learn as much as they can about the universe and how it works. They use tools like telescopes to look at the universe and make observations. They also use computers to analyze data and make predictions about what might happen in the future. By studying the universe, astronomers can help us better understand our place in the universe.

This includes stars, planets, galaxies, and even asteroids and comets. It's like being a space detective, trying to figure out the secrets of the universe. Astronomers use special tools like telescopes and space probes to gather information about the universe. They want to learn more about how the universe began, how it's changing, and what it's made of.

Astronomy is the study of the universe beyond Earth’s atmosphere. This includes stars, planets, galaxies, and space itself. It helps us learn about how the universe was formed, how it is changing, and what mysteries remain unsolved. Astronomers use special tools, like telescopes, to observe objects in space. They also study space rocks, comets, and meteorites to understand more about the universe. By learning about the universe, astronomers can discover new things and make predictions about what will happen in the future. This knowledge helps us understand our place in the universe.
